meanings.definition: A large body of troops ready for battle.
meanings.sent1: The battalions marched in formation towards the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The general commanded the battalions to advance on the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The battalions were so eager to fight, they almost tripped over each other.
meanings.sent4: The battalions stood like a wall of steel, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the battalions' footsteps echoed through the valley, striking fear into the hearts of their foes.

meanings.definition: A large group or force working together towards a common goal.
meanings.sent1: The environmental activists formed battalions to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers formed battalions to distribute food to the needy.
meanings.sent3: The battalions of students worked tirelessly to organize the charity event.
meanings.sent4: The battalions of workers united to demand fair wages.
meanings.sent5: The battalions of ants moved in perfect harmony, each knowing its role in the colony.
